metadata.title: CVE-2023-1829 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux Kernel traffic control indexfilter (tcindex) can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation.The tcindex_delete function which does not properly deactivate filters incase of a perfect hashes while deleting the underlying structure which canlater lead to double freeing the structure. A local attacker user can usethis vulnerability to elevate its privileges to root. We recommendupgrading past commit 8c710f75256bb3cf05ac7b1672c82b92c43f3d28.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-71-generic - 5.15.0-71.78
linux-image-5.15.0-71-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-71.78
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-71-generic - 5.15.0-71.78
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-71-generic-64k - 5.15.0-71.78
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-41-generic - 5.19.0-41.42~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-41-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-41.42~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-41-generic - 5.19.0-41.42~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-41-generic-64k - 5.19.0-41.42~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-71.78').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-41.42~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1032.37').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1035.39').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1037.44').
linux-azure-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-6.2, was needed').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1037.44.1').
linux-gcp package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1032.37').
linux-gkeop package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1019.24').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1029.32').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1030.35').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-71.78').
linux-lowlatency-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-lowlatency-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1034.40').
linux-oem-5.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.17.0-1031.32').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1015.15').

linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1028.30').
linux-azure-fde-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-fde-6.2, was needed').
